event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: The administrator should look at the domain's console to identify the cause of the panic. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The XSCF has detected that a Solaris domain has panic'ed.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The XSCF has detected that a Solaris domain has panic'ed.

The reason for the domain panic is unknown by XSCF software.

*** THERE IS NO DIAGNOSIS PERFORMED BY THE XSCF ***

The domain panic could be due to either a hardware or software problem.

The domain will attempt to save the error telemetry and then perform diagnosis on system reboot.

In the event the system is unable to save the error telemetry or produce an automated diagnosis,
then the information from the system console may be useful in attempting to manually diagnose the domain panic.

The system administrator should examine output displayed to the XSCF console, domain's console,
domain logs files (/var/adm/messages, fmdump -v) and XSCF logs files (fmdump -m, fmdump -v) to
gain a further understanding of the problem.


  If there is no explanation why the domain domain panic'ed,  
  then proceed with the steps outlined below.


       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:41:00 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: bacfa243-a8f3-4ce2-8c38-ee0afc468092
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8005-PX for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8005-PX, TYPE: Upset, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Major
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:41:00 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: bacfa243-a8f3-4ce2-8c38-ee0afc468092
   DESC: The XSCF has detected that a Solaris domain has panic'ed.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8005-PX for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: No action is taken due to this fault.
   IMPACT: The Solaris domain has panic'ed.
   REC-ACTION: The administrator should look at the domain's console to identify the cause of the panic.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command

   
   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u bacfa243-a8f3-4ce2-8c38-ee0afc468092

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:41:00.6912 bacfa243-a8f3-4ce2-8c38-ee0afc468092 SCF-8005-PX
           100%  upset.chassis.domain.panic

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/domain=0
                    Affects: -
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                             server-id=san-ff2-21-0/component=CHASSIS


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
response
event_registry_properties.item: No action is taken due to this fault.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: The XSCF has detected that a Solaris domain has panic'ed.
